Articles.Content:
I have more or less retired. But don't worry, I turned the code over to someone and he should post something about the project soon.

So long everyone!

AK

I have more or less retired. But don't worry, I turned the code over to someone and he should post something about the project soon.

So long everyone!

AK

Aahh! I hope this doesn't get abandoned, it looks really promising!

Noooo!!!!

Don't leave us!!!!

noooooo!!!!

<tap tap tap> Is this thing on?? <SqueeeeeeCH>

...em. Right then....

Edited July 11, 2013 by Kragrathea
Fixed it.
Greetings Kerbals! Allow me to whet your appetite with some random development screenshots from our fabulous Kragrathea factory floor. Set to some of your planets tribal music.
Holy crap that is amazing

Greetings Kerbals! Allow me to whet your appetite with some random development screenshots from our fabulous Kragrathea factory floor. Set to some of your planets tribal music.

...

Did someone see where my jaw went? It fell on the floor a few minutes ago, didn't quite see where it rolled off to...

...

Did someone see where my jaw went? It fell on the floor a few minutes ago, didn't quite see where it rolled off to...

My jaw exploded, it kind of hurts.

WOW does not even come close.

Those are actual planets? Not 'parts' like the various asteroids are? I know what I saw......but its just to awesome, so I have to ask.

If this is released as mod Id have to say it would be the most game changing mod there is....and thats saying something!!

...

Did someone see where my jaw went? It fell on the floor a few minutes ago, didn't quite see where it rolled off to...

I don't know where mine went, but I think I got yours, it doesn't fit right... Anyways, with the extra stars, do they emit light visibly on the planets (stock and mod) and for solar panels?

Edited July 11, 2013 by Itsdavyjones
Forgot to add question...

...

....

Urgha kah ug yue yue ug hurblakr?

...

*Click*

Sorry, I had to find my jaw. Where can I buy my own minisystem? Is release soon? With custom planets? Can mechjeb get to them?

Because that... IS AWESOME.

Apparently they do work with MechJeb -- I was freezing the vid at screens showing UI, and it shows MechJeb executing orbit and landing maneuvers on these bodies.

Incidentially, I counted 11 celestial bodies beyond the standard set. In order of appearance (of the name): Bogy, Joker, Beta Juice, Inferno, Heart of Gold, Trillian, Alpha Juice, WhySo, Serious, Aqua, and Krag. Did I miss any? Also, were Alpha & Beta Juice the names of the two stars?

I really enjoy the whole Douglas Adams twist being put to this =)

Really hope this is made stable and released.
Well isn't this special.
Too amazing. I'm really impressed! You made so many of them too!
I can't find my jaw? Has anyone found their jaw?

I can't find my jaw? Has anyone found their jaw?

I think I found your jaw... mine stayed firmly attached, thankfully.
I am sorry... Have I reached the right system??... I expected a civilized client, not a species flinging jaw bones around. Have I dialed wrong? Oh dear....

Question:

How far away from Kerbol can other stars/planets be placed?

Question:

How far away from Kerbol can other stars/planets be placed?

Thank you for your question. And not throwing your jaw at me.

As to how far out stars can be. Units are difficult between species. But in your terms its "As far as Texas is big". Or something. Thats what came out of the unit translator...
This is very awesome indeed! Is there going to be a Testing Version released soon? Or is it still too far off for any release.

I am sorry... Have I reached the right system??... I expected a civilized client, not a species flinging jaw bones around. Have I dialed wrong? Oh dear....

Welcome to Earth! We usually do that when something FREAKING AWESOME comes along. Like this mod!

*jaw drops over keyboard. ERMAGHERD! NEW PLERNERTS! Seriously, you've progressed so much! Can't wait to land on them.

Edited July 11, 2013 by astropapi1

There's another one... Just try not to trip over all the jaws.

NOTICE:

If you have lost your jaw, contact the lost and found. Try not to lose any more limbs than is absolutely necessary.

Our Janitorial staff thank you in advance.

Apparently they do work with MechJeb -- I was freezing the vid at screens showing UI, and it shows MechJeb executing orbit and landing maneuvers on these bodies.

Incidentially, I counted 11 celestial bodies beyond the standard set. In order of appearance (of the name): Bogy, Joker, Beta Juice, Inferno, Heart of Gold, Trillian, Alpha Juice, WhySo, Serious, Aqua, and Krag. Did I miss any? Also, were Alpha & Beta Juice the names of the two stars?

Ah! An observant Kerbal! You are correct, we have many prototypes on display. Alpha and Beta Juice are indeed graced to be stars (twins!). Serious is also a star. But far away, massive and lonely. Bit of a pain in the arse if you ask me....

There are two more probably not named in the video. Fred and Ginger. Delightful couple! They circle something we called a manilo.

Edited July 11, 2013 by Kragrathea
